intro: Clematis traversiana, commonly known as the blue clematis, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets, and it produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often overlooked. Clematis traversiana prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun. It is a climbing plant that can grow up to several meters in height, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking ornamental vines.
